intro: Desmostemon zeylanicus var. minor, commonly known as the lesser Indian balsam, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its upright stem and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical significance lies in its ornamental value and ecological role in tropical ecosystems.
